Fact: The first email was sent by Ray Tomlinson to himself in 1971.
The first domain name ever registered was Symbolics.com on March 15, 1985.
The first website was dedicated to information about the World Wide Web and was published on August 6, 1991 by Tim Berners-Lee.
More than 3.5 billion Google searches are made every day.
The first smartphone was called Simon, designed by IBM in 1992 and released in 1994.
The original name of Windows was Interface Manager.
The first computer virus was created in 1983 and called the 'Elk Cloner'.
The first Google Doodle was a Burning Man stick figure that appeared on August 30, 1998.
The first YouTube video was uploaded on April 23, 2005, by co-founder Jawed Karim.
Twitter was originally called 'twttr'.
